overview: From 2026-01-25 to 2026-02-01, elizaos-plugins/registry had 2 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 4 active contributors.

topPRs.title: Add AsterPay plugin reference to index.json
topPRs.author: timolein74
topPRs.body:
x402 payment plugin with EUR off-ramp via SEPA Instant for European AI agents. Features: - MAKE_PAYMENT, RECEIVE_PAYMENT, CHECK_BALANCE, CONVERT_TO_EUR - MiCA-compliant, ERC-8004 compatible Demo: https://asterpay.io/elizaos Repo: https://github.com/AsterPay/plugin-payments # Registry Update Checklist Registry: - [x] I've made the left side of the colon of JSON entry in index.json match the potential NPM package name - [x] I've used github not github.com - [x] There is no .git extension - [x] It's placed it alphabetically in the list - [x] I've dealt with commas properly so the list is still valid JSON If not an eliza-plugins official repo, i.e. new plugin: The plugin repo has: - [x] is publically accessible (not a private repo) - [x ] uses main as it's default branch - [x] I have include `elizaos-plugins` in the topics in the GitHub repo settings. If the plugin is related to `AI` or `crypto`, please add those as topics as well. - [x] add simple description in github repo - [x] follows this convention ``` plugin-name/ ├── images/ │ ├── logo.jpg # Plugin branding logo │ ├── banner.jpg # Plugin banner image ├── src/ │ ├── index.ts # Main plugin entry point │ ├── actions/ # Plugin-specific actions │ ├── clients/ # Client implementations │ ├── adapters/ # Adapter implementations │ └── types.ts # Type definitions │ └── environment.ts # runtime.getSetting, zod validation ├── package.json # Plugin dependencies └── README.md # Plugin documentation ``` - [x] an `images/banner.jpg` and `images/logo.jpg` and they - Use clear, high-resolution images - Keep file sizes optimized (< 500KB for logos, < 1MB for banners) - Follow the [elizaOS Brand Guidelines](https://github.com/elizaOS/brandkit) - Include alt text for accessibility - [x] package.json has a agentConfig like the following ```json { "name": "@myNpmOrg/plugin-example", "version": "1.0.0", "agentConfig": { "pluginType": "elizaos:plugin:1.0.0", "pluginParameters": { "API_KEY": { "type": "string", "description": "API key for the service" } } } } ``` ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added support for the payments plugin, enabling new payment processing capabilities. ✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds the AsterPay payment plugin to the registry, which provides EUR off-ramp functionality via SEPA Instant for European AI agents. **Changes:** - Added `@asterpay/plugin-payments` entry to `index.json` pointing to `github:AsterPay/plugin-payments` - Entry is correctly placed in alphabetical order (first entry after opening brace, before `@bealers`) - Follows the required format: NPM package name mapped to GitHub repository reference - JSON syntax is valid with proper comma placement **Repository Verification:** The PR description indicates the plugin includes: - Actions: MAKE_PAYMENT, RECEIVE_PAYMENT, CHECK_BALANCE, CONVERT_TO_EUR - MiCA-compliant and ERC-8004 compatible - Demo available at https://asterpay.io/elizaos - Repository at https://github.com/AsterPay/plugin-payments The PR author has confirmed completion of the registry checklist including proper NPM package naming, GitHub reference format, alphabetical placement, and plugin repository requirements (public repo, main branch, `elizaos-plugins` topic, proper structure, images, and `agentConfig` in package.json).

Confidence Score: 5/5

- This PR is safe to merge with minimal risk - The change is a simple, well-formatted addition to the registry index. The entry follows all formatting requirements: correct alphabetical placement, proper JSON syntax, valid NPM package name format, and correct GitHub reference format without .git extension. The author has completed the comprehensive checklist verifying the plugin repository meets all requirements. - No files require special attention

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Added `@asterpay/plugin-payments` entry in correct alphabetical position with proper format |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant Registry as index.json participant CI as GitHub Actions participant Generated as generated-registry.json Dev->>PR: Submit PR with new plugin entry PR->>Registry: Add "@asterpay/plugin-payments" Note over Registry: Entry added alphabetically
Format: NPM name → GitHub repo PR->>CI: Trigger on merge to main CI->>Registry: Read index.json CI->>CI: Fetch repo metadata
(tags, branches, package.json) CI->>Generated: Generate registry with metadata Generated-->>CI: Commit updated file Note over Generated: Available for CLI consumption ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!

topPRs.title: Add Agent Index plugin for x402 endpoint discovery
topPRs.author: CIII-glitch
topPRs.body:
## Plugin Details **Package:** `agentindex-eliza-plugin` **Repository:** https://github.com/CIII-glitch/agentindex-eliza-plugin **NPM:** https://www.npmjs.com/package/agentindex-eliza-plugin ## Description Agent Index plugin enables Eliza agents to discover x402 endpoints - the payment-enabled APIs in the x402 ecosystem. ### Actions - `SEARCH_AGENT_INDEX` - Search for x402 endpoints by keyword, category, or price - `TRENDING_ENDPOINTS` - Get trending x402 endpoints ### Installation ```bash npm install agentindex-eliza-plugin ``` ### Usage ```typescript import { agentIndexPlugin } from 'agentindex-eliza-plugin'; // Add to your Eliza agent plugins: [agentIndexPlugin] ``` ## Links - Website: https://theagentindex.app - API Docs: https://api.theagentindex.app/docs.html - x402 Protocol: https://x402.org ## Summary by CodeRabbit ## Chores * Added a new plugin source to the available registry, expanding the integration ecosystem. ✏️ Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds the `agentindex-eliza-plugin` to the elizaOS plugin registry. The plugin enables Eliza agents to discover x402 payment-enabled API endpoints. **Key Changes:** - Added registry entry mapping `agentindex-eliza-plugin` to `github:CIII-glitch/agentindex-eliza-plugin` - Plugin provides actions for searching x402 endpoints and viewing trending endpoints **Issues Found:** - **Alphabetical ordering violation**: The entry is placed at the top of the file but should appear after all `@`-scoped packages (between `@tonyflam/plugin-openchat` and `plugin-connections` at line 215-216). The README explicitly requires alphabetical sorting of entries.

Confidence Score: 2/5

- Not safe to merge due to alphabetical ordering requirement violation - The change itself is simple and follows the correct format for registry entries. However, it violates the explicit alphabetical sorting requirement documented in the README (line 23). This will cause inconsistency in the registry and may affect automated processing or searching. The entry must be moved to the correct alphabetical position before merging. - index.json requires the entry to be moved to the correct alphabetical position (after line 215)

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | index.json | Added `agentindex-eliza-plugin` entry but violates alphabetical ordering requirement |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Dev as Plugin Developer participant PR as Pull Request participant GHA as GitHub Actions participant Reg as Registry (index.json) participant Gen as generated-registry.json participant CLI as elizaOS CLI Dev->>PR: Add plugin entry to index.json PR->>GHA: Trigger on merge to main GHA->>Reg: Read index.json GHA->>GHA: Fetch plugin metadata from GitHub GHA->>GHA: Gather version info from Git tags GHA->>GHA: Check NPM package metadata GHA->>Gen: Generate and commit updated registry CLI->>Gen: Fetch plugin registry data CLI->>CLI: Display available plugins Dev->>CLI: Install plugin via elizaOS CLI CLI->>GitHub: Clone plugin repository CLI->>CLI: Load plugin dynamically ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!
